newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat futures weak, adrift at midsesssion.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat futures weak, adrift at midsesssion.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures were weak and drifting at the midsession on an overall lack of news, traders said.

"There's a lot of spreading going on, but otherwise we're drifting here. Not much news, although there is some talk of Egypt taking their business elsewhere. That was in the market yesterday," a trader said.
Egypt recently opted not to purchase U.S. soft red wheat because of concerns over vomitoxin.
By 1201 CDT, KCBT wheat was one to two cents per bushel lower, with Sept down two cents at $4.80.
Man International was said to have bull-spread 1.5 million Sept/Dec bushels at between 3-1/2 and four cents.
Traders said CIS bear-spread one million Dec/Sept bushels at between 3-1/2 and four cents.
